attributes.comment:
To Whom it May Concern:

My husband and I have just had our dossier logged in by the Chinese government
and are now looking at a wait to match of approximately 17 - 20 months. Because
of this extensive wait we are certain to have to renew our fingerprints and
I600A paperwork which will result in yet another unplanned adoption expense. To
date we have invested (financed) nearly $10,000 in the adoption process and
won't be able to recover any of these funds until our adoption has been
finalized. Since it is likely to be nearly 2 years from now you can imagine
that the idea of having to carry this debt all-the-while incurring new expenses
is a source of financial stress on our family. The fact that we will have to
renew our immigration paperwork in the first place and having to pay the
additional $685 promises to only compound this stress. The prospect of these
fees being increased to $830 (an increase of nearly 22 percent) seems incredible.

While we certainly understand that fees must sometimes be increased, it would
seem appropriate to implement a tier-based system that would alleviate some of
the financial burden from adopting families. For example: first time
applicants would pay the new fees of $670 plus $80 for fingerprints per person
but applicants who were originally processed under the "old" fee schedule but
who are forced to have to renew these documents because of extensive wait times
would pay a reduced "renewal" fee.

Adoption is a lengthy and costly process and one that many qualified families
already shy away from because of the high costs. Please don't add to this
problem by making your fees so high that average American?s can?t afford them.
Thank you for taking my comments into consideration when making your decision.

Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kathleen Cybulski
